ygData.subject: Re:
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t think that s a good idea. I ve seen RPGs with tags, and they re kinda missing something. I can t really say what, but it isn t as good as knowing

I don't think that's a good idea. I've seen RPGs with tags, and 
they're kinda missing something. I can't really say what, but it 
isn't as good as knowing what's going on everywhere.


--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kevin Ramsey <kramsey20@y...> wrote:
> I agree. 
> 
> But is anybody else annoyed about having to read EVERY
> message in your inbox only to find that about 75% of
> what you read neither pertains to your
> character/characters or has any interest to you at
> all? (considering that my box fills up with an average
> of 30 NBWRPG posts an hour, I'm willing to bet that at
> least some of you don't have time to rifle through up
> to 100 messages a day if you only have time to do
> e-mail once or twice a day.). I wouldn't mind things
> changing. Maybe a tag system where at the end of the
> message everybody puts in parentheses say...(Tag: John
> Doe) or something. Or maybe an Attention system in
> every subject header, say...."Your Subject Header Here
> (ATTN: Optimus Prime)". If something is REALLY
> important, the subject header could be (ATTN:
> Everyone). 
> 
> I remember being told shortly after I joined that the
> current system is SUPPOSED to be so everybody has to
> go through every message. But considering that most of
> the posts here are one-liners and/or complete drivel
> (that's not to say EVERY post are one-liners or drivel
> though), doing that just seems like a Unicron-sized
> waste of time.
> 
> 
> Any thoughts anyone?
> 
> --- Rudra656@a... wrote:
> >     As much as I enjoy watching pointless arguments,
> > this could drive another 
> > wedge between people in the group.  We don't need
> > that.  Alten, as amusing as 
> > the post was, it went beyond the bounds of good
> > taste.  From an objective 
> > perspective, Yan probably could have been less harsh
> > but his point was valid.
> > 
> 
>
